<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>WHITEHALL -- A boil-water notice will go into effect in the town and village on Sunday, officials said Friday.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The state Department of Health is advising people to boil drinking water or use bottled water for all culinary purposes starting Sunday to coincide with a waterline project to fix a major water leak in the northern end of the village.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>For human consumption, tap water should be boiled at a rolling boil for at least a minute and then cooled before using.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>The public health notice will be lifted when two consecutive days of testing meet the standards of the Health Department.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1420333"></div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>People are advised to follow the order to prevent disease-causing organisms from existing in their water.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1420330"></div></div>
</div>

</div></div></div></div><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=2ba207c8-c780-11e1-8e98-0019bb2963f4&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=2ba207c8-c780-11e1-8e98-0019bb2963f4&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '2ba207c8-c780-11e1-8e98-0019bb2963f4') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://poststar.com/tncms/block/1421721/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Thursday, July 5, 2012

The following is a list of upcoming area events as provided to The Brazil Times:

Boil Order

Due to an outage of the high service pumps at the Carbon Water Works booster station, the water pressure in Carbon's water system fell below 20 psi.

When water pressure within a water system falls below 20 psi, towns and cities are required by the state to issue a boil water advisory.

Effective immediately, Carbon water customers will be on a boil order until further notice.

No Burning

Due to extreme weather conditions, the Harmony Town Council is asking all residents to not conduct any outside burning until further notice.

New Group

The Scrapettes are proud to announce their new scrapbooking group.

They are asking anyone to come have fun with them, make new friends and preserve memories.

Cost is $5 per person and all money goes to the senior center for cost of use of the building.

Those ages 18-older are invited.

The meetings will take place during the last Saturday of each month at the Clay County Senior Citizen's Center, 120 S. Franklin St., Brazil.

For more information, call Diana Hody at 812-235-2114 or Miranda White at 812-420-2166.

Office Hours

The main office of Northview High School will be open Monday, Wednesday and Friday during the summer from 8 a.m.-noon, beginning June 15 through July 23.

Transcripts and work permits may be obtained during those times.

The office will reopen for regular business hours Tuesday, July 24.

For further information, call 448-2661.

Scheduled Meetings

The Clay County Local Emergency Planning Committee will conduct its regular 2012 meetings prior to the Clay County Fire Chief's Association at 6 p.m., with the chief's meetings at 7 p.m., during the following dates:

* Aug. 21 -- At the Van Buren Fire House, and

* Nov. 20 -- At the Posey Township Fire House.

Festival Meeting

The Center Point Community Fall Festival Committee will meet Friday, July 6, at 6 p.m., at the Center Point Hardware store.

All interested parties are encouraged to attend.

For further information, call 835-2161 or 835-3211.

Karaoke!

The Clay County Senior Citizen's Center, 120 S. Franklin St., Brazil, will host Mel's Karaoke Friday, July 6, at 6 p.m.

All are welcome to the event.

Food will be served as a fundraiser.

Health Tour

The Walgreens Way to Well Health Tour with AARP will visit the Brazil Walgreens Monday, July 9, from 11 a.m.-5 p.m.

The event will provide health tests, education and consulting services for free.

Association To Meet

McCullough Zion Gummere Cemetery Association will meet July 9, at 7 p.m., at Zion Church. All interested persons should attend.

For more information, call Kenny Slater at 812-864-2354.

Park Board Meeting

The Brazil Parks and Recreation Board will meet Tuesday, July 10, at 6:30 p.m., in Brazil City Hall Council Chambers.

General business will be discussed and the public is welcome to attend.

FPSD Issues Boil Order

July 5, 2012
Wetzel Chronicle
Save | Post a comment |

The Friendly Public Service District, which serves some customers in Wetzel County, has issued a 72-hour boil order based on the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources' advisory. It says, "Due to the statewide power outages, any area that had low water pressure, no water service, or cloudy water is being placed on a boil water advisory. The advisory will remain in effect until the water service issues a notice lifting the advisory."

FPSD Manager Bob Patterson said, "We did not have a line break." However, the utility did have one of their 10 water tanks go dry, necessitating the order. They are currently refilling the tanks and he is taking a water sample to be tested. Once that is verified as drinkable, hopefully by tomorrow, the order will be lifted.

The affected areas are: Buck Run Road, Whiskey Run Road, Dutch Run Road, Cider Run Road, Paden Fork Road, Gamble Run Road, state Route 180 north of Buck Run Road, and Oil Ridge Road, north of Starkey Lane.

Article Photos

Residents are still urged to conserve water during this time.

While boil orders are in effect, consumers are advised to boil their drinking water (a full rolling boil) for at least one minute prior to drinking, using for cooking, or for hygienic purposes such as hand washing, bathing, or teeth brushing.

More information about water safety is available online at www.wvdhhr.org/oehs

<p><strong>SAN LUIS</strong> — State officials lifted a boiled-water advisory for town residents Tuesday just one day after it had been issued.</p>
<p>Testing of the water system for the San Luis Water and Sanitation District revealed that no contamination had occurred, according to a press release from the Costilla County Health Department.</p>

</div></div><p>The water system suffered a loss in pressure Sunday after a water pump malfunctioned, prompting the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment to issue the order Monday.</p>
<p>A drop in pressure poses a danger that contamination can enter pipes through small cracks or openings.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-middle-asset, stf","fold":"span","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/chieftain.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/news\/region"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-middle-asset">
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1358733"></div><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1360219">
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center ">
<div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-refreshable="true" id="ad-1360219" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;">
<script>
                googletag.cmd.push(function() {
                    googletag.display('ad-1360219');
                    
                });
            </script>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><p>In addition to testing, the sanitation district also flushed its system, which serves the town's roughly 620 residents and a handful of homes to the southeast and east of town.</p>
<p>This week's order was the second in four months as the town endured a six-day order in February.</p>
<p>Since that episode the sanitation district has chlorinated the town's water supply.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-97886 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news tag-boil-order admin-category-breaking-news-email-story" id="post-97886">
<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1 400w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=84&crop=1 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=169&crop=1 300w" width="400"/> </a>
</div>
<div class="modal hide fade" id="thumbnail-modal" tabindex="-1">
<div class="modal-header">
<button aria-hidden="true" class="close" data-dismiss="modal" type="button">×</button>
<h4 class="title">KCMO Boil Advisory Ends</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="480" sizes="(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=640" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg 640w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300 300w" width="640"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Kansas City officials have given the all-clear and lifted a boil advisory affecting residents in Southeast Kansas City Wednesday afternoon, about 24 hours after it was issued.</p>
<p>A power problem at a pump station prompted the city to issue a boil order for a large part of Southeast Kansas City on Tuesday afternoon.</p>
<p>The power outage caused low water pressure and as a precaution authorities asked all customers who live in the area south of I-70 to 87th Street and the area from Blue Ridge Cutoff east to the city limits, to boil their drinking or cooking water for at least three minutes.</p>
<p>Water samples were collected to confirm water quality .</p>
<p>For more information about the boil advisory contact Water Services Dispatch Office at 816-513-0416 or <a href="http://www.kcmo.org/CKCMO/index.htm">click here</a>.</p>
<p>The problem at the pump station affected residents in Blue Springs and Lee’s Summit, as well. The cities asked residents to reduce their use of water. Blue Springs has since cancelled the request.</p>
<p>.</p>
</div>

Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-97886 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news tag-boil-order admin-category-breaking-news-email-story" id="post-97886">
<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1 400w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=84&crop=1 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=169&crop=1 300w" width="400"/> </a>
</div>
<div class="modal hide fade" id="thumbnail-modal" tabindex="-1">
<div class="modal-header">
<button aria-hidden="true" class="close" data-dismiss="modal" type="button">×</button>
<h4 class="title">KCMO Boil Advisory Ends</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="480" sizes="(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=640" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg 640w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300 300w" width="640"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Kansas City officials have given the all-clear and lifted a boil advisory affecting residents in Southeast Kansas City Wednesday afternoon, about 24 hours after it was issued.</p>
<p>A power problem at a pump station prompted the city to issue a boil order for a large part of Southeast Kansas City on Tuesday afternoon.</p>
<p>The power outage caused low water pressure and as a precaution authorities asked all customers who live in the area south of I-70 to 87th Street and the area from Blue Ridge Cutoff east to the city limits, to boil their drinking or cooking water for at least three minutes.</p>
<p>Water samples were collected to confirm water quality .</p>
<p>For more information about the boil advisory contact Water Services Dispatch Office at 816-513-0416 or <a href="http://www.kcmo.org/CKCMO/index.htm">click here</a>.</p>
<p>The problem at the pump station affected residents in Blue Springs and Lee’s Summit, as well. The cities asked residents to reduce their use of water. Blue Springs has since cancelled the request.</p>
<p>.</p>
</div>

Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-97886 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news tag-boil-order admin-category-breaking-news-email-story" id="post-97886">
<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1 400w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=84&crop=1 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=169&crop=1 300w" width="400"/> </a>
</div>
<div class="modal hide fade" id="thumbnail-modal" tabindex="-1">
<div class="modal-header">
<button aria-hidden="true" class="close" data-dismiss="modal" type="button">×</button>
<h4 class="title">KCMO Boil Advisory Ends</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="480" sizes="(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=640" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg 640w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300 300w" width="640"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Kansas City officials have given the all-clear and lifted a boil advisory affecting residents in Southeast Kansas City Wednesday afternoon, about 24 hours after it was issued.</p>
<p>A power problem at a pump station prompted the city to issue a boil order for a large part of Southeast Kansas City on Tuesday afternoon.</p>
<p>The power outage caused low water pressure and as a precaution authorities asked all customers who live in the area south of I-70 to 87th Street and the area from Blue Ridge Cutoff east to the city limits, to boil their drinking or cooking water for at least three minutes.</p>
<p>Water samples were collected to confirm water quality .</p>
<p>For more information about the boil advisory contact Water Services Dispatch Office at 816-513-0416 or <a href="http://www.kcmo.org/CKCMO/index.htm">click here</a>.</p>
<p>The problem at the pump station affected residents in Blue Springs and Lee’s Summit, as well. The cities asked residents to reduce their use of water. Blue Springs has since cancelled the request.</p>
<p>.</p>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
var highlander_expando_javascript = function(){
	var input = document.createElement( 'input' ),
	    comment = jQuery( '#comment' );

	if ( 'placeholder' in input ) {
		comment.attr( 'placeholder', jQuery( '.comment-textarea label' ).remove().text() );
	}

	// Expando Mode: start small, then auto-resize on first click + text length
	jQuery( '#comment-form-identity' ).hide();
	jQuery( '#comment-form-subscribe' ).hide();
	jQuery( '#commentform .form-submit' ).hide();

	comment.css( { 'height':'10px' } ).one( 'focus', function() {
		var timer = setInterval( HighlanderComments.resizeCallback, 10 )
		jQuery( this ).animate( { 'height': HighlanderComments.initialHeight } ).delay( 100 ).queue( function(n) { clearInterval( timer ); HighlanderComments.resizeCallback(); n(); } );
		jQuery( '#comment-form-identity' ).slideDown();
		jQuery( '#comment-form-subscribe' ).slideDown();
		jQuery( '#commentform .form-submit' ).slideDown();
	});
}
jQuery(document).ready( highlander_expando_javascript );
</script>

Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-97886 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news tag-boil-order admin-category-breaking-news-email-story" id="post-97886">
<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=400&h=225&crop=1 400w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=84&crop=1 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=169&crop=1 300w" width="400"/> </a>
</div>
<div class="modal hide fade" id="thumbnail-modal" tabindex="-1">
<div class="modal-header">
<button aria-hidden="true" class="close" data-dismiss="modal" type="button">×</button>
<h4 class="title">KCMO Boil Advisory Ends</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="480" sizes="(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px" src="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=640" srcset="https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg 640w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150 150w, https://localtvwdaf.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/boil.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300 300w" width="640"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Kansas City officials have given the all-clear and lifted a boil advisory affecting residents in Southeast Kansas City Wednesday afternoon, about 24 hours after it was issued.</p>
<p>A power problem at a pump station prompted the city to issue a boil order for a large part of Southeast Kansas City on Tuesday afternoon.</p>
<p>The power outage caused low water pressure and as a precaution authorities asked all customers who live in the area south of I-70 to 87th Street and the area from Blue Ridge Cutoff east to the city limits, to boil their drinking or cooking water for at least three minutes.</p>
<p>Water samples were collected to confirm water quality .</p>
<p>For more information about the boil advisory contact Water Services Dispatch Office at 816-513-0416 or <a href="http://www.kcmo.org/CKCMO/index.htm">click here</a>.</p>
<p>The problem at the pump station affected residents in Blue Springs and Lee’s Summit, as well. The cities asked residents to reduce their use of water. Blue Springs has since cancelled the request.</p>
<p>.</p>
</div>

Boil Order For Rural Water District #2

By Suzie Gilbert&nbsp|&nbsp
Posted: Wed 12:30 PM, Jul 04, 2012 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Thu 9:12 AM, Jul 05, 2012

OSAGE COUNTY, Kan. (WIBW) -- A boil warning has been put in place for Osage County residents. Officials say it's due to a water main break in Rural Water District #2.

Officials say Osage County residents should boil their water as a precautionary measure. They should do so until further notice, which officials say will likely be Thursday (7/5) at the earliest.

Boil Water Notice Issued for Parts of Washington County

By KBTX News Staff&nbsp|&nbsp
Posted: Wed 3:56 AM, Jul 04, 2012

A boil water notice has been issued for Washington County residents living in the northeastern part of the county.

Last Friday the Bluebonnet Rural Water Corporation began experiencing water outages in the Old Washington area.

Water crews have identified three major leaks and repairs are underway.

Until further notice, residents are being asked to boil the water and conserve.

Boiling is critical because it will destroy harmful bacteria and other microbes present in the water.

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality requires the company to alert customers to problems and to inform them when the boil water notice is lifted.

      Boil Order Issued In Franklin County

      Franklin County, VA. - The Franklin County Health Department and The Virginia Department of Health issued a boil water order for customers of Highland Lake Waterworks.

      Do not drink the tap water without boiling it first.

      This boil order is in effect until further notice.

      The boil water order was called due to the power outage from the storms.

      The outage has caused the water supply to drop and require water hauling to maintain water service.

Boil advisories lifted, Lee's Summit residents must conserve water

Posted: Updated:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -

Lee's Summit issued a mandatory water restriction alert late Wednesday afternoon.

Four cities had asked residents to reduce their water consumption after a Kansas City pump station failed Tuesday.

Blue Springs, Raytown, Lee's Summit and Kansas City had asked residents to voluntarily restrict their water use. Because people cooperated, Blue Springs, Raytown and Kansas City have lifted this, but it remains in place in Lee's Summit.

And now the restrictions have become mandatory. All outdoor watering is prohibited.

This came the same afternoon that Raytown and Kansas City lifted their boil advisories.

Blue Springs residents were safe to use water as normal as of Tuesday night.

The pump station failed Tuesday because of electrical issues. The pump was fixed late Tuesday night.

Lee's Summit continues to ask residents to conserve water. In a news release, Lee's Summit officials said the failure means Kansas City cannot provide up to 7 million gallons of water to Lee's Summit residents.

Residents are asked to stop using sprinklers and irrigation systems. Do not leave hoses or faucets running.

Boil advisories lifted, Lee's Summit residents must conserve water

Posted: Updated:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -

Lee's Summit issued a mandatory water restriction alert late Wednesday afternoon.

Four cities had asked residents to reduce their water consumption after a Kansas City pump station failed Tuesday.

Blue Springs, Raytown, Lee's Summit and Kansas City had asked residents to voluntarily restrict their water use. Because people cooperated, Blue Springs, Raytown and Kansas City have lifted this, but it remains in place in Lee's Summit.

And now the restrictions have become mandatory. All outdoor watering is prohibited.

This came the same afternoon that Raytown and Kansas City lifted their boil advisories.

Blue Springs residents were safe to use water as normal as of Tuesday night.

The pump station failed Tuesday because of electrical issues. The pump was fixed late Tuesday night.

Lee's Summit continues to ask residents to conserve water. In a news release, Lee's Summit officials said the failure means Kansas City cannot provide up to 7 million gallons of water to Lee's Summit residents.

Residents are asked to stop using sprinklers and irrigation systems. Do not leave hoses or faucets running.

Boil advisories lifted, Lee's Summit residents must conserve water

Posted: Updated:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -

Lee's Summit issued a mandatory water restriction alert late Wednesday afternoon.

Four cities had asked residents to reduce their water consumption after a Kansas City pump station failed Tuesday.

Blue Springs, Raytown, Lee's Summit and Kansas City had asked residents to voluntarily restrict their water use. Because people cooperated, Blue Springs, Raytown and Kansas City have lifted this, but it remains in place in Lee's Summit.

And now the restrictions have become mandatory. All outdoor watering is prohibited.

This came the same afternoon that Raytown and Kansas City lifted their boil advisories.

Blue Springs residents were safe to use water as normal as of Tuesday night.

The pump station failed Tuesday because of electrical issues. The pump was fixed late Tuesday night.

Lee's Summit continues to ask residents to conserve water. In a news release, Lee's Summit officials said the failure means Kansas City cannot provide up to 7 million gallons of water to Lee's Summit residents.

Residents are asked to stop using sprinklers and irrigation systems. Do not leave hoses or faucets running.

Most Local Utilities Confirm There Is No Boil Order Here

July 3, 2012
BY AMY WITSCHEY - Editor (editor@wetzelchronicle.com) , Wetzel Chronicle
Save | Post a comment |

There has been talk of a statewide boil order, but most local utilities are telling the Wetzel Chronicle that there are no boil orders in effect here.

Specifically, New Martinsville, Paden City, and Hundred are saying they are not instructing people to boil their water before consumption, cooking, and other sanitary uses.

The press release that is causing the confusion is from the West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources. It says, "Due to the statewide power outages, any area that had low water pressure, no water service, or cloudy water is being placed on a boil water advisory. The advisory will remain in effect until the water service issues a notice lifting the advisory."

Article Photos

Wetzel County Office of Emergency Management Agency Director Ed Sapp says all water utilities in the county are up and running. Some, such as Pine Grove, Reader, and Grandview-Doolin, may still be generating or distributing water thanks to generator power.

The Hundred-Littleton PSD never ran out of pressure, keeping the water flowing throughout the recent emergency situation. This was thanks to the PSD crew keeping the water tank stocked. Consequently they had a full supply to use when the power went out after Friday's storm. Without that reserve, they probably would have been without water on Sunday. The town shut down high water usage businesses such as the laundromat, car wash, and restaurants so as to conserve the water reserve. Those businesses reopened today. The PSD only needed to operate on generator power for three hours before electric service was restored.

Of course those rural customers without public water service rely on electric well pumps for water. Those who still are without power are also without water. Sapp said 5,000 gallons of water was distributed to the county's fire departments on Monday. Another shipment today provided two palates of water to each fire department and they should be receiving another load of water tonight or in the morning. He said the Reader Volunteer Fire Department had even been delivering water to some residents.

The heat has certainly been a factor, so cooling shelters have been opened. The most used one is the Lewis Wetzel Family Center in New Martinsville, but the Mollohan Center at the 4-H Camp and the Pine Grove Volunteer Fire Department are also available for that purpose. The Hundred VFD is also available as needed, but Sapp expects little use there as many homes in that area have power restored. The New Martinsville Parks & Recreation Department is even offering free swimming at Lewis Wetzel Park through Wednesday.

Sapp said most of the storm damage appears to be minor. "I don't know that we had more than one or two houses that were made uninhabitable from a tree falling on them," he noted. Most damage was to siding and roofs with the loss of shingles or tin sheeting.

"Once the response phase is over, then FEMA (Federal Emergency Management Agency) will kick in and begin the recovery," said Sapp, who noted the federal agency will set up centers for people to come in and fill out paperwork for assistance.

Further, he said the West Virginia Division of Highways is reporting that some back roads still have trees across them, but Sapp said there are probably very few impassable by now.
